title: On the Stage!
text: Although just a minor, theater and performance is a major part of Carolynn‚Äôs life! It‚Äôs hard to know her without knowing all of the other people she‚Äôs has the pleasure of being. Just for fun, here are some of her favorite moments on the stage.

title: On the Stage!
text:
‚ÄúI‚Äôm Not Afraid of Anything‚Äù ‚Äì February 2025
Hooligan Theatre Company‚Äôs annual Cabaret featured a variety of vocal performances by students, who sang a repertoire of 2000s-themed musical songs. Carolynn sang ‚ÄúI‚Äôm Not Afraid of Anything‚Äù from Songs for a New World. Carolynn‚Äôs favorite part of this performance was beautifully emotional, yet uplifting aura of the song. Watch the full performance here!

title: On the Stage!
text:
Curtains ‚Äì December 2024
In Curtains, Carolynn played the character of Georgia Hendricks, one half of a song-writing duo with her ex-husband Aaron Fox. After the star of Robbin‚Äô Hood the Musical dies in a tragic accident (or did she?), Georgia steps into the role of leading lady, all while other members of the theater company start to mysteriously meet their ends. Carolynn‚Äôs favorite part of this role was getting to play two different characters: a endlessly worried and unsure Georgia yearning for a resolution to her and Aaron‚Äôs relationship, as well as the bold and brash Madam Marian, whose boundless confidence becomes clear in great numbers like ‚ÄúThataway!‚Äù

title: On the Stage!
text:
‚ÄúWe Beseech Thee‚Äù ‚Äì May 2024
In Hooligan Theatre Company‚Äôs annual Showcase, several different scenes, dances and songs are performed. Carolynn was featured as a dancer in a staging of ‚ÄúWe Beseech Thee‚Äù from Godspell. Carolynn‚Äôs favorite part about this performance was the upbeat dancing, cheery music and lyrics, and being able to put on a show with her favorite people.


Your browser does not support the video tag.

title: On the Stage!
section: Sunday in the Park with George ‚Äì December 2023
text:
Sunday in the Park with George ‚Äì December 2023
In this surreal depiction of the life of famous painter Georges Seurat, Carolynn played the role of Yvonne, the pretentious, arty wife of the famed painter Jules. While George pioneers the esteemed pointillism technique he eventually integrates into renowned works such as A Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte, he fends off the ostentatious critiques of Jules and Yvonne. Carolynn‚Äôs favorite part of being in this show was the incredibly beautiful music, composed by the late-yet-great Stephen Sondheim, and getting to comprise a husband-wife duo with a dear and remarkably talented friend.

title: On the Stage!
text:
Spamalot ‚Äì April 2023
Spamalot is a goofy musical adaptation of Monty Python‚Äôs film Monty Python and the Holy Grail. While the musical keeps most of the classic comedic elements from the original movie, such as the use of coconuts to mimic horses‚Äô hooves and the killer rabbit, it also develops upon the character of the Lady of the Lake, who appears sporadically throughout the show to aid Arthur and his knights in their quest for the Holy Grail (or to remind the audience she‚Äôs the star). Carolynn‚Äôs favorite parts about this role was its challenging vocal demands and multitude of extravagant makeup and costume changes. It was a wonderfully pleasing role, both for the crowd and for the actor who had the delight of bringing it to life.

title: Introduction
text: Carolynn Rui is currently a fourth-year UCLA student double majoring in Psychology and Statistics with a minor in Theater. She‚Äôs especially interested in how data and human behavior intersect in research, and currently volunteers as a finance associate for Hooligan Theater Company. When she‚Äôs not analyzing numbers, she‚Äôs probably singing, performing, or planning her next adventure with friends. On weekends, you‚Äôll find her exploring new spots in LA, trying out fun activities, or just making great memories with the people around her. If you‚Äôre interested in her previous work and leadership experience, take a look at her resume!
